Amazon: All You Need To Know About The Upcoming, High-Profile Antitrust Lawsuit","teaser":" ","body":"\u003cp\u003eThe Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is coming down hard on Big Tech. President Joe Biden-appointed commissioner\u003cstrong\u003e Lina Khan \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/government/23/06/33056426/us-federal-trade-commission-plans-to-prosecute-amazons-core-online-marketplace-citing-alleged-abuse\"\u003eis expected to soon file a new antitrust lawsuit against \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon.com, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e) that risks breaking apart some parts of the company.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe FTC recently lost an antitrust lawsuit \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/07/33239593/microsoft-activision-acquisition-clears-another-hurdle-as-ftcs-appeal-to-block-the-deal-falls-th\"\u003ewhich tried to stop \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft Corp.\u0026#8217;s\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e) $69 billion acquisition of \u003cstrong\u003eActivision Blizzard Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ATVI#NASDAQ\"\u003eATVI\u003c/a\u003e). The Department of Justice is reportedly reading an antitrust lawsuit against \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc\u003c/strong\u003e. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) and has already sued Google\u0026#8217;s parent company, \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e)(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOGL#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e), for monopolizing digital advertising technologies, in a case that now has 17 U.S. states involved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe FTC's upcoming lawsuit against Amazon's core business, which could be filed as soon as August, has the potential to make a lasting impact on the company's dominance over the retail market across the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eLina Khan's Case Against Amazon\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn 2017, current FTC Commissioner Lina Khan was a student at Yale Law School. The third-year law student, then 29 years old, published a groundbreaking paper in the Yale Law Journal which marked a historic moment in U.S. antitrust law.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe paper, praised by academics and bipartisan politicians, shed a new light on the interpretation of what a monopoly can look like after a look at Amazon's business model.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAntitrust law in the U.S. had so far been focused on \"consumer welfare.\" This means that the most important data used by antitrust regulators to analyze whether a company's operations were against public interest was pricing data. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn traditional economic theory, competition incentives lower prices and for that reason is more desired than a monopoly, where one company dominates that market and is able to manipulate prices at will.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSince Amazon is known for offering low prices to the public, it was kept out of antitrust scrutiny for years. What Khan observed was that this framework was obsolete when looking at Amazon's control and power over the retail market in modern times.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\"We cannot cognize the potential harms to competition posed by Amazon's dominance if we measure competition primarily through price and output,\" wrote Khan.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon's platform approach creates incentives for it to pursue growth over profits, using predatory pricing structures that hurt competition, she argues. Additionally, integration across business lines positions the company \"to control the essential infrastructure on which their rivals depend.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFour years later, after serving as a legal fellow at the FTC, Kahn was nominated by Biden to lead the agency and was voted in by a bipartisan Senate, which emphasized the scholar\u0026#8217;s original views on Amazon as a reason behind their support.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eKhan's FTC v. Amazon\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis is not the first time the FTC, under Khan\u0026#8217;s leadership, has brought its might down on Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEarlier this year, the e-commerce giant \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/government/23/06/32663055/amazon-agrees-to-pay-over-30m-to-settle-alexa-ring-spying-claims-despite-disagreement-with-ftc\"\u003eagreed to pay $30.8 million in settlements with the FTC\u003c/a\u003e over allegations of spying on customers through Ring doorbell cameras and violating children's privacy rights with Alexa recordings.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe FTC has interviewed over 30 Amazon employees under oath during 2022, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-06-29/amazon-major-ftc-antitrust-case-expected-in-coming-weeks?sref=TBDibEcD\"\u003eaccording\u003c/a\u003e to a Bloomberg report.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnother lawsuit was filed last week by the agency, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/government/23/06/32959638/amazon-accused-of-duping-consumers-into-prime-subscriptions-by-ftc-reuters\"\u003eclaiming that Amazon has been tricking consumers into signing on to its Prime service\u003c/a\u003e and then making it too difficult to cancel the subscription.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe FTC is separately investigating Amazon's proposed acquisition of automatic vacuum cleaner maker \u003cstrong\u003eiRobot \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/IRBT#NASDAQ\"\u003eIRBT\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eYet the upcoming antitrust lawsuit is the biggest move in Khan's playbook yet. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe original probe was launched in 2019 but was put on the back burner as most of the agency's workforce was focused on a probe against \u003cstrong\u003eMeta\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003ePlatforms Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e), which cost the company (then called Facebook) a $5 billion fine for mishandling user data. The investigation into Amazon resurfaced when Khan came into FTC leadership.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe new antitrust lawsuit could be filed as soon as August, people familiar with the matter \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2023/07/25/ftc-lawsuit-break-up-amazon-00108130\"\u003etold Politico\u003c/a\u003e, and if won, it has the potential to impose a court order for restructuring Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA key issue in the upcoming lawsuit is Amazon's control over the commercial success of third-party sellers. The company, it is claimed, to direct sellers to use its own delivery and warehousing services by penalizing those who choose to work independently and rewarding the ones that do by giving them better positions within product listings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA pressure that forces sellers to use Amazon's ad services to better place products on the site is also under scrutiny.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon's platform approach through Amazon Prime, which now includes book publishing, TV and film productions as well as music and video streaming, could also be part of the probe, which could claim Amazon exerts excessive control over the market through the advantages provided to consumers by Prime subscriptions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon has claimed that Khan's previous criticism of the company should warrant her recusal from the case. The FTC is expected to file the lawsuit in a federal court instead of its own in-house tribunal, which would mute that claim.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmazon Price Action: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon shares are up 1.8% on Thursday, recovering from losing over 2% on Wednesday before the market opened. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile some analysts \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/trading-ideas/long-ideas/23/07/33393424/amazon-falls-following-reports-ftc-aims-to-break-up-the-company-a-technical-analysis\"\u003eblamed the looming FTC lawsuit for the drop\u003c/a\u003e, CNBC's Jim Cramer said he believed \u003ca Teams boast over 300 million monthly active users.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft said it respects the European Commission\u0026#39;s work and is committed to finding solutions to address their concerns. However, AI chip sales are expected to be the lone bright spot in which growth should continue. The logical conclusion is that AI-oriented chip firms remain investment worthy which is exactly the thesis for the firms in this article on top semiconductor stocks to watch.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eSemiconductor Stocks to Watch:\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eASML (ASML)\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/stockstobuy1600_11-300x169.jpg\" alt='a green button on a keyboard has an arrow pointing upward with the word \"Buy\". representing safe stocks to buy' width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: AdityaB. Photography/ShutterStock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eASML\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/asml-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eASML\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) has already performed very well this year. The company is the leader in a niche market that includes few competitors at all and none which can match its technological capabilities. The result is that its shares can likely move even higher.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eASML\u0026rsquo;s extreme ultraviolet technology is applied to its massive lithography machines used for the manufacture of the world\u0026rsquo;s most complex chips. No other firms are as capable as ASML in this regard. That means it essentially has a monopoly on the production and sale of these machines that cost hundreds of millions of dollars.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAI chip production is an order of magnitude more difficult which only gives ASML a greater advantage. Its lithography machines are going to continue to be in higher demand as firms look to produce AI chips en masse. That\u0026rsquo;s part of the reason ASML is confident that sales will increase by \u003ca href=\"https://www.asml.com/en/news/press-releases/2023/q2-2023-financial-results\"\u003e30% in 2023\u003c/a\u003e. In turn, that confidence serves as a signal to investors that ASML stock is a buy at this time.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eSemiconductor Stocks to Watch:\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eSynopsys (SNPS)\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/stockstobuy1600_12-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"A businessman ripping his shirt off to reveal an upward green arrow with the word buy on it underneath\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: ImageFlow/Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe current race to design and produce AI chips benefits\u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003e Synopsys\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/snps-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSNPS\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e).\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company provides design automation software for the semiconductor industry. Synopsys\u0026rsquo; DSO.ai product is an AI integration into the design software that searches for optimization targets in the design phase of chip manufacturing. The appeal of the product is obvious: Firms want optimized chips and Synopsys\u0026rsquo; AI-driven software allows that to occur. Synopsys also has AI integrations for the verification and test phases of chip production, VSO.ai, and TSO.ai.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSynopsys saw its revenues increase in the\u003ca href=\"https://news.synopsys.com/2023-05-17-Synopsys-Posts-Financial-Results-for-Second-Quarter-Fiscal-Year-2023\"\u003e most recent quarter\u003c/a\u003e and in the most recent trailing 6 months. However, net income fell slightly as higher costs eroded margins. It hasn\u0026rsquo;t much-affected share prices at all. Instead, they\u0026rsquo;ve risen quickly following the release as it exceeded guidance. It remains one of the lesser-discussed chip stocks but one which is very much worth considering for its overall utility within the sector.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eSemiconductor Stocks to Watch:\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eApplied Materials (AMAT)\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/stocks-to-buy-1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"Stocks to buy: smartphone with the words \u0026quot;buy\u0026quot; and \u0026quot;sell\u0026quot; displayed on the screen. The user's finger is about to press buy. Stock charts are in the background of the image. Momentum Stocks\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Chompoo Suriyo / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eApplied Materials \u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amat-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMAT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) provides manufacturing equipment to the chip industry. Share prices for AMAT stock have fallen following the TSMC news, creating an opportunity.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApplied Materials is a more conservative semiconductor investment overall. It includes a dividend with a yield approaching 1%. During the most recent quarter, Applied Materials returned $219 million to shareholders via that dividend. The firm also repurchased an additional $800 million of shares. It\u0026rsquo;s clear that the company is more focused on shareholders than growth relative to younger chip firms. The point is that AMAT shares offer stability and price appreciation through the growing chip market opportunity.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRevenues \u003ca href=\"https://ir.appliedmaterials.com/static-files/55fd56b6-e672-4bc1-9729-8457dc99aab4\"\u003eincreased\u003c/a\u003e by 6% while net income increased by 3%. Those metrics suggest Applied Materials is, again, a steady choice for more risk-averse investors.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLike every other chip firm, Applied Materials recognizes the transformative power of AI for its business. The firm believes parallel innovation rather than serial innovation is the path forward. That means Applied Materials believes industry cooperation will push forward its progress.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNvidia (NVDA)\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/growth-stocks-1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"tree growing on coin of stacking with green bokeh background; growth stocks\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Freedom365day / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs I write this,\u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003e Nvidia\u0026rsquo;s\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/nvda-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVDA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) stock continues to fall the day after TSMC\u0026rsquo;s bad news. Meanwhile, the majority of other chip stocks have shown signs of a quick rebound. I think this is an obvious opportunity for Nvidia investors.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTSMC already noted that AI chips are the lone bright spot it sees in terms of revenues in 2023. And Nvidia is the biggest and best AI chipmaker. It\u0026rsquo;s really a very simple choice to be bullish on NVDA shares right now. Remember, Nvidia expects roughly $11 billion in sales in Q2 which is far greater than the $7 billion Wall Street had previously been expecting. That still remains and Nvidia won\u0026rsquo;t release those earnings until Aug. 21.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShares are trading below $450 but analysts believe they could go \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/market-data/quotes/NVDA/research-ratings\"\u003eas high as $767\u003c/a\u003e in the next 12 months. Don\u0026rsquo;t be surprised if they rise dramatically again. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) is set to begin an AI subscription model for 365 Office which should increase revenues. Other firms are going to drive value from AI chips as well and that means Nvidia could see even higher demand soon.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMD (AMD)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/bank-lending-capital-1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"hands at desk near laptop computer, with one hand holding a pile of hundred dollar bills. Bank stocks\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: shutterstock.com/CC7\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eAMD\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amd-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMD\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) offers a lot of potential for investors seeking a true breakout stock. Its breakout potential is all due to its competition with Nvidia in relation to AI chip dominance.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt\u0026rsquo;s no secret that Nvidia is winning to this point. Its chips are regarded to be the most advanced for AI applications which have caused share prices to skyrocket in 2023. For investors looking for a challenger to that dominant position, AMD is a clear choice. That pursuit could logically see AMD share break out at some point. As a result, purchasing now is probably a smart idea.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat said, let\u0026rsquo;s analyze AMD in relation to Nvidia and AI. \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/amds-ai-chips-could-match-nvidias-offerings-software-firm-says-2023-06-30/#:~:text=June%2030%20(Reuters)%20%2D%20Artificial,by%20an%20AI%20software%20firm.\"\u003eMosaicML\u003c/a\u003e compared both firms\u0026rsquo; second-best chips and found that AMD chips were roughly 80% as powerful as those from Nvidia. The company believes that further software updates should make the chips equivalent in terms of performance. The company went on to say that AMD excels at software whereas other firms have struggled. Importantly, software is one of the most powerful areas in which improvements to AI chips can be made. That further suggests that AMD is not very far behind Nvidia and that shares could soon benefit.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMarvell Technology (MRVL)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/shutterstock_104712719-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"A person draws a stock chart on a chalkboard.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Zurijeta / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eMarvell Technology\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mrvl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMRVL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) is a very heavily favored chip stock. The 30 analysts with coverage of the firm are in near unanimous agreement that it is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/market-data/quotes/MRVL/research-ratings\"\u003ebuy\u003c/a\u003e. There\u0026rsquo;s nearly 10% upside implied by those prices and Marvell Technology pays a dividend so returns could be even higher.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company provides cloud-optimized chips and is one of the better data infrastructure firms in relation to semiconductors. Marvell Technology helps firms improve their data infrastructure either on-premise or through the cloud.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt is also one of the chip firms that has benefited from AI this year. CEO Matt Murphy earlier stated that \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/marvell-technology-is-the-latest-tech-firm-to-benefit-from-ai-7504792\"\u003eAI revenues will accelerate in H2\u003c/a\u003e of this year. The firm\u0026rsquo;s networking chips are its main AI product and manufacturing is just ramping up. The firm expects AI revenues to double next year after production comes online fully. That should set shares up for a breakout at some point.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eQualcomm (QCOM)\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/stocks-to-buy-greedy1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"man's hand holding wads of cash. stocks to buy. Stocks With 1000% Upside\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Vova Shevchuk / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn some sense, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003eQualcomm\u0026rsquo;s\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/qcom-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eQCOM\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) stock might seem like a chipmaker to avoid on the TSMC news. TSMC was clear that it sees a slowdown in mobile phone chip production but again sees AI chip sales improving.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eQualcomm is a major mobile phone chip provider. It is an integral partner of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003eApple\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aapl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAAPL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) in particular. That relationship is set to continue to be strong \u003ca href=\"https://www.macrumors.com/2023/01/09/apple-in-house-modem-chips-2024/#:~:text=Apple%20will%20start%20with%20using,components%20from%20Broadcom%20in%202025.\"\u003ethrough 2025\u003c/a\u003e even as Apple begins to transition away from Qualcomm intending to bring production in-house.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eiPhone sales aren\u0026rsquo;t slowing down. That means that Qualcomm should be fine. Its AI mobile phone chips are particularly strong and despite Apple\u0026rsquo;s desire to move away from Qualcomm, it isn\u0026rsquo;t that simple. Qualcomm has Apple cornered in that regard and as iPhone sales continue to be strong Qualcomm\u0026rsquo;s mobile chip sales should remain strong too. That seems to be what the market said the day after the TSMC news as shares rebounded by more than 4%.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn the date of publication, Alex Sirois did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/\"\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Publishing Guidelines\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAlex Sirois is a freelance contributor to InvestorPlace whose personal stock investing style is focused on long-term, buy-and-hold, wealth-building stock picks. Having worked in several industries from e-commerce to translation to education and utilizing his MBA from George Washington University, he brings a diverse set of skills through which he filters his writing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eMore From InvestorPlace\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/07/venture-capitalist-predicts-this-chatgpt-announcement-will-shock-the-world/?cid=MKT744191\u0026amp;eid=MKT752258\"\u003eThe #1 AI Name for 2023 Could Be About to Ignite This $20.6 Trillion Wealth Shift\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/07/elon-musks-project-omega-stuns-silicon-valley-insiders/?cid=MKT738510\u0026amp;eid=MKT752256\"\u003eMusk\u0026rsquo;s \u0026ldquo;Project Omega\u0026rdquo; May Be Set to Mint New Millionaires. Here\u0026rsquo;s How to Get In.\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2022/06/this-could-be-the-best-deal-in-the-history-of-independent-investing-research/?cid=MKT638063\u0026amp;eid=MKT752248\"\u003eThe $1 Investment You MUST Take Advantage of Right Now\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/05/secret-income-blueprint-of-the-one-percent/?cid=MKT730394\u0026amp;eid=MKT752254\"\u003eThe Rich Use This Income Secret (NOT Dividends) Far More Than Regular Investors\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe post \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/07/7-semiconductor-stocks-to-buy-before-the-breakout/\"\u003e7 Semiconductor Stocks to Buy Before the Breakout\u003c/a\u003e appeared first on \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://investorplace.com/2023/07/7-semiconductor-stocks-to-buy-before-the-breakout/?utm_source=benzinga\u0026utm_medium=quotes\u0026cc=quotes\u0026cp=benzinga","image":[],"channels":[],"stocks":["AAPL","AMAT","AMD","ASML","MRVL","MSFT","NVDA","QCOM","SNPS","TSM"],"tags":[]},"33433944":{"id":33433944,"author":"InvestorPlace","created":"Thu, 27 Jul 2023 19:54:51 -0400","updated":"Thu, 27 Jul 2023 19:57:06 -0400","title":"3 Tech Stocks to Buy Before the Breakout","teaser":"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\nThe top tech stocks like Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), Meta (NASDAQ:META) and others have led the market higher. Not just other tech sectors and industries, but","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe top \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/\"\u003etech stocks\u003c/a\u003e like \u003cstrong\u003eNvidia\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/nvda-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVDA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eMeta\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/meta-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMETA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) and others have led the market higher. Not just other tech sectors and industries, but the market as a whole. So far this year, the \u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq\u003c/strong\u003e is up 34.5% while the \u003cstrong\u003eS\u0026amp;P 500\u003c/strong\u003e is up almost 19%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eKnown as \u0026ldquo;relative strength\u0026rdquo; stocks, investors keep circling back to tech as a way to generate portfolio alpha vs. the overall market. It\u0026rsquo;s a stock picker\u0026rsquo;s market, and even though the rally has been broadening out to include other industries and sectors, tech remains red hot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor good reason, it\u0026rsquo;s got investors looking for the best tech stocks to buy pre-breakout.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCan these names continue to charge higher or will momentum finally waver? Unfortunately, even when stocks look tired and need to consolidate, no one knows when the uptrend will actually end. The more that investors doubt the rally, the more likely it is to continue higher.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWith that in mind, let\u0026rsquo;s look at a few top tech stocks from a technical analysis perspective.\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eTop Tech Stocks: Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"Alphabet Inc. (GOOG, GOOGL) and Google logos seen displayed on smartphones. The Google stock split is happening today.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/googl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOGL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOG\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) just \u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/alphabet-stands-out-in-a-trio-of-unimpressive-earnings/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e earnings on Tuesday July 25, beating on analysts\u0026rsquo; top- and bottom-line expectations. An earnings and revenue beat is important \u0026mdash; provided that the company also tells a good story.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAt a time where other stocks are not reacting well to earnings \u0026mdash; including \u003cstrong\u003eTesla\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/tsla-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTSLA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eSnap\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/snap-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSNAP\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) and \u003cstrong\u003eNetflix\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/nflx-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNFLX\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) \u0026mdash; Alphabet is trading well on its results.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eNot only is that a bullish catalyst, but it\u0026rsquo;s also a potential bearish landmine that\u0026rsquo;s out of the way. Now the stock is trying to close over the June high and the second-quarter high of $129.04. If it can do so, it creates a monthly-up and quarterly-up rotation, helping to open the door to the upper $130s, then potentially the $150 level.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor what it\u0026rsquo;s worth, Alphabet \u003cem\u003ewas\u003c/em\u003e the worst-performing FAANG stock of the year. Now earnings have vaulted it higher, while Netflix has fallen hard after its results, making Alphabet the \u003cem\u003esecond\u003c/em\u003e worst-performing FAANG component of 2023.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCould this kickstart a catch-up trade?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eBest Tech Stocks to Buy Pre-Breakout: DigitalOcean (DOCN)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/docn-stock-1-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"A laptop screen displays the logo for DigitalOcean (DOCN).\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: monticello / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDigitalOcean\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/docn-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDOCN\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) jumped on the AI bandwagon a few weeks ago, following its \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/06/digitalocean-acquires-cloud-computing-startup-paperspace-for-111m-in-cash/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eacquisition\u003c/a\u003e of Paperspace, an \u0026ldquo;AI-focused cloud computing startup\u0026rdquo;. The move vaulted the stock into a new wave of momentum, which is rare for the acquiring company.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEven before the deal though, DOCN stock was trading much better. Shares were up more than 55% ahead of the news and are currently up over 85% as we speak.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile management has made the decision to put more focus on its bottom line, DigitalOcean continues to grow at an impressive clip. \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/DOCN/analysis?p=DOCN\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eForecasts\u003c/a\u003e call for 22% revenue growth this year and almost 18% growth in fiscal 2024. However, the focus on the bottom line is important in an uncertain environment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAs for the charts, keep an eye on the $47.25 area. That\u0026rsquo;s the Q2 high and a clear breakout point on the chart. On July 25, DOCN did a good job holding this level as support, but it was under pressure again on the 26th. That may set up a deeper correction, potentially down to the $44 to $45 zone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf that\u0026rsquo;s the case, keep watching for a potential breakout back over that $47.25 area. That opens the door back up toward $50, then hopefully, $53-plus.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eAI Stocks Not Done Going Higher?: C3.ai (AI)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/c3ai-ai-stock-1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"C3.ai (AI) logo on a smartphone with computer screen showing graph in background, symbolizing AI stock\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: shutterstock.com/Below the Sky\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLast but not least, we have a true AI stock on our hands with \u003cstrong\u003eC3.ai\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ai-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e). This has been one of the top tech stocks of 2023, with shares up more than 250% for the year. Shares are up about 140% from the low in early May.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the stock did not have a great reaction to earnings the way investors had been hoping \u0026mdash; expectations for guidance were quite high after Nvidia \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nvidia-stock-explodes-after-guidance-for-the-ages-what-wall-street-is-saying-120105455.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereported its robust results\u003c/a\u003e \u0026mdash; C3.ai has found its stride.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe company reported near the end of May, so it will be a little while before we hear from it again. Still, after a post-earnings dip, the stock was able to find its footing and resume the upside move. Eventually it took out the pre-earnings high and nearly traded up to $49.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFrom here, let\u0026rsquo;s see if this tightening wedge pattern can resolve higher. A lot of eyes have been on this one over the last few days, waiting to see if it can clear the $42 to $42.50 zone. Above last week\u0026rsquo;s high at $43.08, then C3.ai could really take off.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the date of publication, Bret Kenwell held a long position in DOCN. This presents an opportunity for investors in undervalued \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/industries/industrial/defense/\"\u003edefense stocks\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor long-term investors seeking stability and growth, defensive stocks offer a strong strategy. These stocks can provide steady growth and protection during market downturns. Here are three top defensive stocks to consider for your portfolio right now.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cb\u003eApple (AAPL)\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/aapl1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"Apple (AAPL) logo brand and text sign on entrance facade store American multinational boutique corporation dealership shop. Apple Layoffs\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: sylv1rob1 / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple\u0026rsquo;s\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aapl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAAPL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) stock is surging with significant momentum. It recently reached an all-time high of around $200 on a split-adjusted basis, becoming the only publicly traded company with a $3 trillion market capitalization, making it the world\u0026rsquo;s most valuable company. The strong demand for its iconic iPhone and the upcoming launch of a new augmented reality headset is driving this success.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple\u0026rsquo;s stock experienced a slight increase on Wednesday \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eafter a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-07-19/apple-preps-ajax-generative-ai-apple-gpt-to-rival-openai-and-google#xj4y7vzkg\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBloomberg News\u003c/em\u003e report\u003c/a\u003e menti\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eoned the company\u0026rsquo;s internal development of an artificial intelligence large language model. The move indicates Apple\u0026rsquo;s interest in AI technology for potential integration into upcoming products. Although it\u0026rsquo;s typically referred to as \u0026ldquo;machine learning,\u0026rdquo; the company already has a prototype chatbot they\u0026rsquo;re calling \u0026ldquo;Apple GPT.\u0026rdquo; Over the past year, there has been growing interest in large language models, an AI technology that can generate human-like text or code. Access to the chatbot is restricted within Apple, and there are speculations that the company may make a significant AI announcement next year. AAPL stock has surged 56% this year, making it attractive to long-term investors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cb\u003eBerkshire Hathaway (BRK-B)\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/brk-2-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"The logo for Berkshire Hathaway displayed on a smartphone screen.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWarren Buffett\u0026rsquo;s \u003cstrong\u003eBerkshire Hathaway\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/brk-a-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBRK-A\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, NYSE:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/brk-b-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBRK-B\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) stands as an impressive force in the investment world. With a market cap of over $740 billion, it has the potential to reach the $1 trillion milestone, signifying substantial growth for the company. On July 17, Berkshire Hathaway stock reached a high point of $523,500 per share, hitting $524,820 earlier that day. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWarren Buffett \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/07/17/warren-buffetts-berkshire-hathaway-cuts-activision-stake-as-microsoft-deal-inches-closer.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esold 70%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan\u003eof the firm\u0026rsquo;s \u003cstrong\u003eActivision Blizzard \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/atvi-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eATVI\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) stake amid the company\u0026rsquo;s remarkable growth and the proposed acquisition by \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBerkshire Hathaway has been actively buying back its own shares, with $4.4 billion repurchased in the first quarter alone. Previously, the ability to repurchase stock was limited, but since 2017, the board allows repurchases if Buffett and Munger believe the stock is undervalued. With significant cash reserves of over $25 billion, Berkshire has the means to continue repurchasing shares.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdditionally, Berkshire Hathaway\u0026rsquo;s appeal lies in its strong track record and diverse holdings, providing stability amid market volatility. While the exact timing of reaching the $1 trillion club remains uncertain, the company\u0026rsquo;s well-curated portfolio is steadily progressing toward this significant milestone, benefiting current and potential investors alike.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cb\u003eRestaurant Brands (QSR)\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/qsr1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Shutterstock\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Q1, \u003cstrong\u003eRestaurant Brands\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/qsr-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eQSR\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) exceeded earnings expectations, reporting a revenue increase of 9.7% to $1.59 billion, surpassing estimates by $30 million. Earnings per share were 75 cents, beating predictions by 11 cents. Despite inflation challenges, the company showed strong growth in comparable and system-wide sales, making a positive start to the year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIndeed, QSR stock has maintained its gains, exhibiting a strong uptrend on the charts. The price surged significantly over the past months, trading above key moving averages and showing potential for further growth beyond $100. Buyers are accumulating, indicating a bullish trend.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRestaurant Brands International, Inc. is a holding company that operates quick-service restaurants under three segments: Tim Hortons, Burger King, and Popeyes. The company is based in Toronto, Canada, and its stock was trading at $77.78 with a 0.67% intraday gain \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eand \u003ca href=\"https://companiesmarketcap.com/rbi/marketcap/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ea market cap\u003c/a\u003e of $\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e35.161 billion at the time of writing. The trading volume has been on the incline as of late, suggesting increased bullishness from large investors in recent days. Perhaps small money investors would do well to follow the big money into this name.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the date of publication, Chris MacDonald has a LONG position in AAPL, BRK-B, QSR. (MSFT), ServiceNow","body":"\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ci\u003eThe software industry is flourishing due to increasing digitization, numerous technological advancements, and high demand for software solutions. As a result, robust software stocks, Microsoft Corp. (MSFT), ServiceNow (NOW), and RingCentral (RNG) could make ideal additions to your portfolio now. Continue reading…\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eBecause of the increasing reliance of enterprises on software solutions, the software industry is poised for significant growth. Technological advancements are strengthening the industry even more by encouraging innovation, improving development processes, and enabling the creation of immersive, interconnected experiences.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eTo that end, it could be wise to invest in fundamentally sound software stocks, Microsoft Corporation (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/MSFT/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e), ServiceNow, Inc. (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/NOW/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNOW\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e), and RingCentral, Inc. (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/RNG/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRNG\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e), that hold the potential to generate solid returns. Let's understand this in detail.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis year, the software industry is poised for robust growth as businesses prioritize spending on software-driven transformation initiatives to gain a competitive edge through increased productivity and automation.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe industry's standout trend lies in software development companies' escalated adoption of \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://connect.comptia.org/content/research/it-industry-trends-analysis\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ecloud-native solutions\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e, empowering application development, team management, and communication. These infrastructure-independent solutions function seamlessly across various servers, ensuring effortless integration for any company.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMoreover, technologies such as AI, cybersecurity, blockchain, software outsourcing, and IoT are catalyzing the industry's expansion by driving innovation, improving security measures, enhancing development processes, and unlocking the potential for immersive, interconnected experiences.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn that note, Gartner forecasts worldwide software spending to reach $911.66 billion in 2023, registering a \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.gartner.com/en/newsroom/press-releases/2023-07-19-gartner-forecasts-worldwide-it-spending-to-grow-4-percent-in-2023\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e13.5% year-over-year\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e increase. Meanwhile, according to Spherical Insights, the global enterprise software market is expected to grow at a \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/en/news-release/2023/01/30/2597857/0/en/Global-Enterprise-Software-Market-Size-To-Grow-USD-519-88-Billion-By-2030-CAGR-of-10-95.html\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eCAGR of 11%\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e and reach $519.88 billion by 2030.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eConsidering the industry's ongoing expansion, solid software stocks MSFT, NOW, and RNG could be ideal investments for potential gains.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eLet's now delve into the fundamentals of these stocks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eMicrosoft Corporation (\u003c/b\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/MSFT/\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eMSFT\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cb\u003e)\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eTech giant MSFT develops software, services, devices, and solutions. It operates through three segments, Productivity and Business Processes, which includes Office, Teams, and LinkedIn; Intelligent Cloud, offering public/private servers and cloud services; and More Personal Computing, encompassing Windows, Devices, Gaming, search, and ads.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn July 26, MSFT partnered with PayPal Holdings, Inc. (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/PYPL/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ePYPL\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e), integrating its Pay Later solution in multiple countries. These integrations are expected to provide flexible payment choices, fostering customer loyalty and potentially benefiting MSFT through increased sales and customer satisfaction.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMoreover, on June 29, MSFT and Moody's Corporation (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/MCO/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMCO\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e) joined forces to offer advanced data, analytics, research, and risk solutions to financial services and global knowledge workers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eBy merging MCO's insights with Microsoft Cloud services such as Azure OpenAI Service, Fabric, and Teams, MSFT aims to provide next-gen solutions for improved business intelligence. This could drive customer adoption and revenue growth and enhance MSFT's market position.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFor the fiscal 2023 fourth quarter that ended June 30, MSFT's gross margin grew 11.2% year-over-year to $39.39 billion. Its \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/operatingincome.asp\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eoperating income\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e rose 18.1% from the year-ago value to $24.25 billion. Also, the company's net income and EPS increased 20% and 20.6% year-over-year to $20.08 billion and $2.69, respectively.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe consensus revenue estimate of $235.12 billion for the fiscal year (ending June 2024) reflects an 11% year-over-year improvement. Likewise, the consensus EPS estimate of $11.02 for the ongoing year indicates a 12.4% rise year-over-year. Moreover, the company topped the consensus EPS estimates in all four trailing quarters.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOver the past six months, the stock has gained 33.3% to close the last trading session at $330.72.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMSFT's solid fundamentals are apparent in its \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/powr-ratings/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ePOWR Ratings\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e. The stock has an overall rating of B, equating to Buy in our proprietary rating system. The POWR Ratings are calculated by considering 118 different factors, each weighted to an optimal degree.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMSFT has a B grade for Stability, Quality, and Sentiment. It has ranked #9 in the 49-stock \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/category/software-business/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eSoftware - Business\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e industry.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eIn addition to the POWR Ratings I've just highlighted, you can see MSFT's ratings for Growth, Value, and Momentum \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/MSFT/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ehere\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eServiceNow, Inc. (\u003c/b\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/NOW/\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eNOW\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cb\u003e)\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNOW offers global enterprise cloud computing solutions that define, structure, consolidate, manage, and automate services. The company's Now platform enables workflow automation, artificial intelligence, machine learning, robotic process automation, data benchmarking, encryption, and collaboration and development tools.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn July 26, NOW and KPMG extended their partnership to transform finance, supply chain, and procurement operations. NOW foresees a $11 billion market by 2025 for procurement and sourcing, along with lucrative opportunities for integrated finance and supply chain solutions on a simplified platform.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNOW's strategic alliance with KPMG could result in significant financial advantages. By co-developing AI-driven solutions, NOW would accelerate its customers' business architecture, delivering heightened speed, productivity, and profitability across finance, supply chain, and procurement operations.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn May 17, NOW and NVIDIA Corporation (\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/NVDA/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e) announced a strategic partnership wherein NOW would utilize NVDA's advanced software and infrastructure to develop custom large language models for its ServiceNow Platform. This would empower IT, customer service, employees, and developers to heighten workflow automation and boost productivity.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFor the second quarter that ended June 30, 2023, NOW's non-GAAP gross profit grew 22.7% year-over-year to $1.76 billion. Its non-GAAP income from operations rose 36.3% from the year-ago value to $544 million. Furthermore, the company's non-GAAP net earnings and non-GAAP EPS came in at $486 million and $2.37, up 47.7% and 46.3% year-over-year, respectively.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNOW's revenue is expected to grow 23% year-over-year to $8.91 billion for the fiscal year ending December 2023. The company's EPS for the same period is estimated to be $9.95, indicating a 31.1% year-over-year improvement. Also, the company surpassed its consensus EPS estimates in all of the trailing four quarters.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe stock has gained 45.2% year-to-date to close the last trading session at $559.89.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNOW's positive outlook is reflected in its POWR Ratings. The stock has an overall rating of B, translating to Buy in our proprietary rating system.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eNOW has an A grade for Growth and a B for Sentiment and Quality. It is ranked #13 out of 49 stocks within the Software – Business industry.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/NOW/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eClick here\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e to access additional NOW ratings (Stability, Value, and Momentum). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eRingCentral, Inc. (\u003c/b\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/RNG/\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eRNG\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cb\u003e)\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRNG is a provider of enterprise cloud communications, video meetings, collaboration, and contact center Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solutions. Its portfolio comprises RingCentral MVP, a UCaaS platform; Customer engagement solutions; and RingCentral Video, a video meeting solution with team messaging, enabling smart video meetings.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eOn June 27, RNG unveiled that it was the first global cloud provider to furnish fully compliant cloud phone services in India. The country's impressive 5.5% average GDP growth over a decade and increasing corporate acceptance for hybrid work provide RNG with a significant opportunity to introduce its leading cloud solutions to this burgeoning market.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFurthermore, on May 8, RNG announced the next generation of RingCentral for Microsoft Teams 2.0. The integration of RNG's premium cloud PBX capabilities within Teams, without requiring an extra application, would attract more customers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eAlso, innovative features and compatibility with RingCentral Contact Center\u0026#x2122; could strengthen RNG's position in the market, driving revenue growth.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFor the first quarter that ended March 31, 2023, RNG's non-GAAP income from operations rose 89.1% year-over-year to $92.01 million. Its adjusted EBITDA grew 71.4% from the year-ago value to $112.30 million.  Also, its non-GAAP net income and non-GAAP EPS increased 95.1% and 94.9% year-over-year to $73.23 million and $0.76, respectively.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe consensus revenue estimate of $2.20 billion for the fiscal year (ending December 2023) reflects a 10.5% year-over-year improvement. Similarly, the consensus EPS estimate of $3.23 for the current year indicates a growth of 62.2% year-over-year. Furthermore, the company topped its consensus EPS estimates in all four trailing quarters.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eShares of RNG have gained 21.1% over the past month to close the last trading session at $39.13.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRNG's robust outlook is apparent in its POWR Ratings. The stock has an overall rating of B, which equates to Buy in our pro­­­­­­­­­prietary rating system.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRNG has a B grade for Growth and Value. It has ranked #14 out of 49 stocks within the same industry.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://stocknews.com/stock/RNG/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eClick here\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e to access additional RNG ratings for Stability, Momentum, Quality, and Sentiment.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003ci\u003e43 Year Investment Pro Shares Top Picks\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eSteve Reitmeister is best known for his timely market outlooks \u0026amp; unique trading plans to stay on the right side of the market action. Click below to get his latest insights… \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://report.stocknews.com/rtrsignup/\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eSteve Reitmeister's Trading Plan \u0026amp; Top Picks \u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003chr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMSFT shares were trading at $338.65 per share on Friday afternoon, up $7.93 (+2.40%). about","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eBefore we dive in today, I want to thank everyone who joined Luke Lango, Eric Fry, and myself last night for our \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT752049\u0026amp;eid=MKT754313\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI Impact Event\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, where we talked about everything AI \u0026ndash; and, most importantly, how to profit from the investment opportunities that come with it.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eIf you missed last night\u0026rsquo;s event, \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT752049\u0026amp;eid=MKT754313\"\u003esimply click here for the replay\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf you\u0026rsquo;re a longtime fan of the Olympics, you might remember the \u0026ldquo;Magnificent Seven.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnd if you don\u0026rsquo;t\u0026hellip;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u0026ldquo;Magnificent Seven\u0026rdquo; was the 1996\u0026nbsp;United States Olympic women\u0026rsquo;s gymnastics team. Seven, for the team\u0026rsquo;s seven members, and magnificent because the team won the first-ever gold medal for the United States in the women\u0026rsquo;s gymnastics team competition.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnd the team clinched the win in a spectacular fashion, with one team member performing a near-perfect vault on an injured ankle.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe members were all later inducted into the United States Olympic Hall of Fame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBut you might have heard this phrase used again recently, albeit for something else\u0026hellip;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u0026ldquo;Magnificent Seven\u0026rdquo; is now used to describe the seven current biggest \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/\"\u003etech stocks\u003c/a\u003e (some of which used to be a part of the FAANG or MAMAA groups).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThey are:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmazon.com, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amzn-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMZN\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOG\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aapl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAAPL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/meta-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMETA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVIDIA Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/nvda-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVDA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/tsla-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTSLA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThese seven stocks, like the gold-medal-winning \u0026ldquo;Magnificent Seven,\u0026rdquo; have achieved greatness in a spectacular fashion: For the first half of the year, the S\u0026amp;P 500 soared 15.9% \u0026mdash; and these stocks accounted for 73% of those gains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFour out of the seven stocks reported earnings over the last two weeks. So, in today\u0026rsquo;s\u003cem\u003e Market 360\u003c/em\u003e, let\u0026rsquo;s take a look at how their earnings stacked up and what each had to say about artificial intelligence (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ai-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e). Then, I\u0026rsquo;ll share where you can find the best \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/artificial-intelligence/\"\u003eAI stocks\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLet\u0026rsquo;s dive in\u0026hellip;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla, Inc \u0026ndash; Reported Wednesday, July 19\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor the second-quarter, Telsa reported impressive sales, earnings and operating margins.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe company reported earnings per share of $0.91, beating analysts\u0026rsquo; expectations of earnings per share of $0.82. This is up from earnings per share of $0.76 in the same quarter last year. Revenue rose 47% year-over-year to $24.93 billion, up from revenue of $16.93 billion a year ago. This topped analysts\u0026rsquo; estimates for $24.47 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, Elon Musk cautioned investors that further price cuts may be necessary, despite price cuts of 14% to 28% this year on its electric vehicles (EVs). Furthermore, Musk also stated that Tesla would scale back its production in the third quarter to update its factories. He said, \u0026ldquo;We continue to target 1.8 million vehicle deliveries this year, but expect Q3 production will be a little bit down because we\u0026rsquo;ve got summer shutdowns for a lot of factory upgrades.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFinally, Musk said that Tesla is investing heavily into supercomputers to develop autonomous driving based on all the data that its cars collect on the road.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe company\u0026rsquo;s shareholder deck states that Tesla\u0026rsquo;s research and development costs rose to $943 million in pursuit of the company\u0026rsquo;s \u0026ldquo;commitment to being at the forefront of AI development entered a new chapter with the start of production of Dojo training computers.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTesla Dojo is a training supercomputer designed by the company that will be used to improve its Full Self-Driving (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/fsd-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFSD\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) advanced driver-assistance system.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMusk\u0026rsquo;s comments about Tesla\u0026rsquo;s autonomous driving development apparently hurt the stock, though, since the company abandoned the LIDAR (Light Detection and Ranging) system. LIDAR is a forward infrared radar. It\u0026rsquo;s used to see animals and people and to avoid collisions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSo, no matter how much data Tesla has, a LIDAR system is superior to Tesla\u0026rsquo;s camera system.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe stock fell nearly 10% on Thursday in the wake of its earnings report.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e\u0026ndash; Reported Tuesday, July 25\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEarnings per share rose 21% year-over-year to $2.69, up from earnings per share of $2.23 in the same period last year. Analysts were expecting earnings of $2.55 per share, so the company topped earnings estimates by 5.5%. Revenue climbed 8% year-over-year to $56.19 billion, up from revenue of$51.87 billion, and beating revenue expectations for $55.47 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eRevenue from Azure, Microsoft\u0026rsquo;s cloud computing platform, and other cloud services revenue, increased 26% during the quarter. Analysts expected 25% growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn the company\u0026rsquo;s earnings call, Amy Hood, Microsoft\u0026rsquo;s finance chief, said:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhen it comes to AI, we are seeing a paradigm shift as the world\u0026rsquo;s large AI models become powerful platforms themselves. With our Azure OpenAI Service, a diverse set of customers, from HSBC, PwC, and RTL Group, to Shell and Wipro, are applying language models to advanced scenarios like content and code generation.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLooking forward, Microsoft called for fiscal first-quarter revenue between $53.8 billion to $54.8 billion. This fell short of the $54.94 billion expected by analysts, so, shares of the company slipped nearly 4% on Wednesday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc. \u0026ndash; Reported Tuesday, July 25\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSecond-quarter earnings per share increased 19% year-over-year to $1.44, up from earnings per share of $1.21 a year ago. This beat analysts\u0026rsquo; earnings expectations for $1.34 per share. Revenue climbed 7% year-over-year to $74.6 billion, up from revenue of $69.7 billion in the same quarter a year ago. Analysts had called for revenue of $72.82 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI should add that Google Cloud sales, which include infrastructure and productivity apps, increased 28% year-over-year to $8.03 billion, which helped boost Alphabet\u0026rsquo;s revenue growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn regard to AI, Sundar Pichai, CEO of Alphabet and Google, said on the company\u0026rsquo;s conference call:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eTo take advantage of the AI opportunities ahead, we\u0026rsquo;ve been sharpening our focus as a company: investing responsibly with great discipline, and finding areas where we can operate more cost effectively. We\u0026rsquo;ve made good progress in data center machine efficiency which will pay dividends as we continue to invest in AI.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBard, Google\u0026rsquo;s AI chatbot, is now available in now available throughout most of the world and can be used in over 40 languages.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSince the release of its earnings report, shares of the stock have hit a slew of new 52-week highs, including one this morning.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms, Inc. \u0026ndash; Reported Wednesday, July 26\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor the second quarter, the company reported earnings per share of $2.98, which was higher than analysts\u0026rsquo; estimates of earnings of $2.91 per share and earnings per share of $2.46 in the same quarter of last year. Revenue increased 11% year-over-year to $32 billion, topping analysts\u0026rsquo; estimates for $31.12 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn a statement, Meta CEO\u0026nbsp;Mark Zuckerberg\u0026nbsp;said:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eMoving onto our product roadmap\u0026hellip; the two technological waves that we\u0026rsquo;re riding are AI in the near term and the metaverse over the longer term. Investments that we\u0026rsquo;ve made over the years in AI, including the billions of dollars we\u0026rsquo;ve spent on AI infrastructure, are clearly paying off across our ranking and recommendation systems and improving engagement and monetization.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLooking forward, Meta expects third-quarter revenue between $32 billion and $34.5 billion, or 15% revenue growth. This is higher than analysts\u0026rsquo; estimates for $31.3 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe stock jumped 9% to a new 52-week high on Thursday and then hit another 52-week high today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAre There Better AI Plays?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt\u0026rsquo;s clear that these companies are going \u0026ldquo;all in\u0026rdquo; on AI, but here\u0026rsquo;s the truth: There are other AI investment opportunities with bigger upside potential than the Magnificent Seven.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSo, on Thursday, I sat down with my colleagues Luke Lango and Eric Fry for a special \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT752049\u0026amp;eid=MKT754313\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAI Impact Event\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to discuss where to find the biggest winners. We also gave away a free special recommendation.
