Hundreds of stocks are about to lose 50% or more of their value in the blink of an eye.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eStocks that have strong market positions today could even find themselves filing for bankruptcy soon. In 2023, a year which has been defined by AI, has seen corporate bankruptcies reach a record 12-year high.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBut this is just the beginning.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis is why we dropped everything to hold our \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT752049\u0026amp;eid=MKT754313\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAI Impact Event\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf you want to get our step-by-step playbook for avoiding the destruction that\u0026rsquo;s about to occur \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e learn about the small unique group of stocks that could jump 10X or more as this AI development unfolds, \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT752049\u0026amp;eid=MKT754313\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ewatch the replay of our \u003cem\u003eAI Impact Event\u003c/em\u003e now\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Editor hereby discloses that as of the date of this email, the Editor, directly or indirectly, owns the following securities that are the subject of the commentary, analysis, opinions, advice, or recommendations in, or which are otherwise mentioned in, the essay set forth below:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVIDIA Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/nvda-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVDA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLouis Navellier, who has been called \u0026ldquo;one of the most important money managers of our time,\u0026rdquo; has broken the silence in \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT499868\u0026amp;eid=MKT529642\u0026amp;encryptedSnaid=\u0026amp;snaid=\u0026amp;step=start\"\u003ethis shocking \u0026ldquo;tell all\u0026rdquo; video\u003c/a\u003e\u0026hellip; exposing one of the most shocking events in our country\u0026rsquo;s history\u0026hellip; and \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT499868\u0026amp;eid=MKT529642\u0026amp;encryptedSnaid=\u0026amp;snaid=\u0026amp;step=start\"\u003ethe one move every American needs to make today\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eMore From InvestorPlace\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2022/07/little-known-apple-project/?cid=MKT639809\u0026amp;eid=MKT752244\"\u003eBuy This $5 Stock BEFORE This Apple Project Goes Live\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/04/one-of-the-worlds-biggest-tech-breakthroughs-could-be-happening-in-americas-heartland/?cid=MKT714907\u0026amp;eid=MKT752250\"\u003eWall Street Titan: Here\u0026rsquo;s My #1 Stock for 2023\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2022/06/this-could-be-the-best-deal-in-the-history-of-independent-investing-research/?cid=MKT638063\u0026amp;eid=MKT752246\"\u003eThe $1 Investment You MUST Take Advantage of Right Now\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/01/one-percenter-issues-urgent-warning/?cid=MKT499868\u0026amp;eid=MKT752252\"\u003eIt doesn\u0026rsquo;t matter if you have $500 or $5 million. Do this now.\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe post \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/market360/2023/07/four-magnificent-companies-report/\"\u003eFour of the \u0026#8220;Magnificent Seven\u0026#8221; Report Earnings \u0026#8211; Here\u0026#8217;s What They Say About AI\u003c/a\u003e appeared first on \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://investorplace.com/market360/2023/07/four-magnificent-companies-report/?utm_source=benzinga\u0026utm_medium=quotes\u0026cc=quotes\u0026cp=benzinga","image":[],"channels":[],"stocks":["AAPL","AMZN","GOOG","META","MSFT","NVDA","TSLA"],"tags":[]},"33451824":{"id":33451824,"author":"InvestorPlace","created":"Fri, 28 Jul 2023 17:11:57 -0400","updated":"Fri, 28 Jul 2023 17:30:14 -0400","title":"3 Growth Stocks to Buy Before the Breakout","teaser":"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\nInterested in building generational wealth? Stock investments traditionally perform better than gold, bonds, real estate, and even cryptocurrency. But if","body":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice \u0026amp; Trading Tips\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInterested in building generational wealth? Stock investments traditionally perform better than gold, bonds, real estate, and even cryptocurrency. But if you invest in high potential \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-types/growth-stocks/\"\u003egrowth stocks\u003c/a\u003e, you better fasten your seatbelt. They can take you on an emotional roller coaster ride.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBetween November 2021 and December 2022, the growth oriented Nasdaq Composite index lost 35% of its value. Year to date, however, it has regained 34% of what it lost. That means it still sits well below where it sat 20 months ago. It also indicates there are bargains waiting to be picked up.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGrowth stock investing isn\u0026rsquo;t for the faint of heart. It requires savvy investors willing to seek out undervalued growth stocks and hold on until the breakout occurs. The following three companies are some of the top growth stocks to buy today.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet (GOOG)(GOOGL)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/alphabet_goog_googl_1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"Alphabet Inc. (GOOG, GOOGL) and Google logos seen displayed on a smartphone\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe owner of dominant search tool Google and video sharing site YouTube remains poised for superior gains in the years to come. \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026lsquo;s (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOG\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e)(NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/googl-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOGL\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) search engine sucks the oxygen out of the search market room with a \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://gs.statcounter.com/search-engine-market-share\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e92.6% share\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, according to data from GlobalStats. Its YouTube platform has \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessofapps.com/data/youtube-statistics/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e2.6 billion active users\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, second only to Google itself and Facebook.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBoth give Alphabet enormous reach and income through advertising. Combined, they provided over $50 billion in revenue in the second quarter, a \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1652044/000165204423000067/googexhibit991q22023.htm\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e5% increase\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from last year. Yet the real opportunity lies elsewhere.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoogle Cloud services, for example, continues to rack up growth. It nearly \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.crn.com/news/cloud/aws-microsoft-google-s-cloud-market-share-q1-2023/2\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003edoubled its market share\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e between 2017 and 2022, going from 6% to 11%. Cloud generated $8 billion in revenue last quarter, up a whopping 28% year over year. With enterprise cloud spending still in its early innings, the platform could readily challenge \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amzn-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMZN\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) and \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) for supremacy.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnalysts expect Alphabet to continue to grow earnings at a better than 15% compounded annual rate for the next five years. Even with the stock up 46% in 2023, there\u0026rsquo;s plenty more room to run.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAxon Enterprise (AXON)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/axon1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"Person holding mobile phone with logo of American weapon manufacturer Axon Enterprise Inc. on screen in front of webpage. Focus on cellphone display. Unmodified photo.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: T. Schneider / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShares of stun gun and body camera maker \u003cstrong\u003eAxon Enterprise\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/axon-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAXON\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) are down 20% from recent highs. The maker of the Taser energy weapon reported lower than expected first quarter growth in future contract revenue. Even though Axon booked a r\u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1069183/000106918323000027/axon-20230509xex99d1.htm\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eecord $4.8 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the period, that was only 3% higher than it had in last year\u0026rsquo;s fourth quarter. The stock selloff represents an opportunity for investors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAxon is a smartly growing company. Its less than lethal weaponry is an essential tool for law enforcement looking to deescalate tense situations. Axon\u0026rsquo;s body cameras are also a high demand product for the protection of police officers and the public. Axon rounds all this out with an evidence database system that is fully integrated into both platforms.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAxon\u0026rsquo;s components are sticky. Once a department becomes enmeshed in one of the platforms, it is difficult to extricate itself to go to a competitor. It is also building profitability. Axon Enterprise reported its fifth consecutive quarter of GAAP profits. With revenue surging 34% in the first quarter, analysts are looking for 34% annual growth in profits.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAxon doesn\u0026rsquo;t look cheap by traditional metrics of price-to-earnings or price-to-sales, but it has rarely traded at so-called normal levels. Look for the stun gun and body cam maker to continue to grow into its valuation.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTrupanion (TRUP)\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/trup1600-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"a veterinarian holding a small white dog\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Shutterstock\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePet insurance specialist \u003cstrong\u003eTrupanion\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/trup-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTRUP\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) is the third growth stock ready to explode. As the humanization of pets continues, the need for pet insurance grows.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe American Pet Products Association says \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/07/3-growth-stocks-that-are-screaming-buys-right-now-july-2023/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003econsumers spent $138.6 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on pet care last year. Insurance is an area that is just beginning to grow extensively. GrandView Research deems it \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.grandviewresearch.com/industry-analysis/pet-insurance-market\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ea $9.4 billion industry\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that\u0026rsquo;s set to grow 17% annually through 2030.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTrupanion is the dominant player in the space with about \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://petkeen.com/pet-insurance-market-share-by-brand/\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e30% of the market\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. The next closest competitor is Nationwide Mutual Insurance with a 19% share. And even though Trupanion derives most of its revenue from the U.S. and Canada, it actually has \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investors.trupanion.com/resource-materials/Top-Investor-Questions/default.aspx\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003egreater penetration rates\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the U.K. and Europe. North American \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1371285/000137128523000047/trup-20221231.htm#ie3c2e010f3a649f89316e458b52d65e4_10\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003epenetration rates\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e run around 2%. It\u0026rsquo;s at 5.6% in Europe and 11.2% in Australia.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat provides for explosive expansion going forward. This is a category still in its infancy but one that will grow by leaps and bounds in the future.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the date of publication, Rich Duprey did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. It has since been updated to include the most relevant information available.\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor a moment, imagine a world of \u003c/span\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003elimitless energy\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u0026ndash; one where energy is so abundant that everyone can power their homes and businesses for mere pennies.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThese days, it\u0026rsquo;s tough to imagine a world like that. Last winter, the average U.S. heating bill was $1,000.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eBut thanks to a potential \u003c/b\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.llnl.gov/news/national-ignition-facility-achieves-fusion-ignition\"\u003e\u003cb\u003eworld-changing scientific breakthrough\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cb\u003e, the ostensibly utopian world of limitless energy could soon become a reality.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrescient investors who place the right bets on the right stocks in this industry could mint fortunes over the next few years.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThat\u0026rsquo;s why both \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e) \u0026ndash; the world\u0026rsquo;s second-most valuable company \u0026ndash; and ChatGPT\u0026rsquo;s creator Sam Altman are both betting big on this very limitless energy breakthrough right now.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eJust last week, Microsoft announced a huge deal to start buying a ton of this limitless energy as soon as 2028.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInterested? You should be\u0026hellip;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe\u0026rsquo;re talking about arguably the biggest scientific breakthrough of our lifetimes. And it could be the \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT730519\u0026amp;eid=MKT754259\"\u003e\u003cb\u003ebiggest investment opportunity of our lifetimes\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, too.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd it all has to do with \u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003enuclear power\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003eThe Power of the Sun\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNuclear power has a bad reputation \u0026ndash; and I get it. It has been used to create bombs that have decimated cities and destroyed lives. And when the world tried to capture that power in nuclear power plants, it often ended in catastrophe. And not once, not twice, but time and time again.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNuclear power deserves its bad rep.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003ci\u003eHowever, not all nuclear power is created equal.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpecifically, there are two types:\u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003e nuclear fusion\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003enuclear fission\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo date, everything achieved with nuclear power has revolved around nuclear fission. That involves splitting apart atoms to capture and use the energy produced from the division.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd it\u0026rsquo;s a very risky and dangerous science for two big reasons.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFirst, splitting atoms creates chain reactions that must be controlled very carefully. Otherwise, they could cause meltdowns and explosions. Second, fission produces radioactive waste, which needs to be stored correctly to avoid contaminating the surrounding environment.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNuclear fission is dangerous stuff.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003ci\u003eBut nuclear fusion is not.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/i\u003e\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/fission-vs-fusion.png\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/fission-vs-fusion.png\" alt=\"An image that illustrates nuclear fission and nuclear fusion and describes what happens in each process\" width=\"624\" height=\"351\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile nuclear fission revolves around splitting atoms, nuclear fusion is all about combining them.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpecifically, nuclear fusion is a process in which atomic nuclei combine to form a heavier nucleus, releasing a large amount of energy in the process. This energy is released in the form of light and heat.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eImportantly, nuclear fusion does not depend on any chain reactions and does not produce any radioactive waste. It is entirely stable without any negative byproducts.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT730519\u0026amp;eid=MKT754259\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eIt\u0026rsquo;s the clean, safe version of nuclear power creation\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eFusion Is Better\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMoreover, nuclear fusion is simply the \u003c/span\u003e\u003ci\u003e\u003cspan\u003ebetter\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/i\u003e\u003cspan\u003e version of nuclear fission. That\u0026rsquo;s because fusion produces infinitely more energy than fission.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConsider this: The sun is powered by nuclear fusion. At the sun\u0026rsquo;s core, temperatures reach up to 27 million degrees Fahrenheit \u0026ndash; hot enough to allow nuclear fusion to take place. Under these extreme conditions, hydrogen atoms are forced together, forming helium and releasing a tremendous amount of energy. This energy is so powerful that it travels to the sun\u0026rsquo;s surface, where it then travels another 93 million miles to warm up and light the Earth.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNuclear fusion is powerful stuff.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInputting just a few pounds of hydrogen into a nuclear fusion reaction will produce as much energy as burning thousands of pounds of coal or oil. Theoretically, a small cup of hydrogen fuel could power a house for hundreds of years. Extending that thinking, a few nuclear fusion reactors could power the entire world for hundreds upon hundreds of years.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eNuclear fusion is the key to creating limitless energy.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf so, then why are there dozens of nuclear fission reactors in the world, yet zero nuclear fusion reactors?\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBecause while nuclear fission is a risky science, nuclear fusion is a tough science. Indeed, it\u0026rsquo;s so tough that no one has figured out how to make a viable nuclear fusion reactor\u0026hellip;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u0026hellip;Until December 2022.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eA Critical Breakthrough for Nuclear Power\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn short, the challenge of nuclear fusion boils down to something called \u0026ldquo;\u003c/span\u003e\u003cb\u003enet energy gain.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u0026rdquo;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNet energy gain is the difference between the energy consumed by an energy production process and the energy produced by it. It is energy output minus energy input.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eObviously, net energy gain must be positive in order for that energy source to be viable. A negative net energy gain means the energy source consumes more energy than it produces.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003eAnd historically, nuclear fusion has suffered from a negative net energy gain.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat\u0026rsquo;s because the conditions under which nuclear fusion is possible are extremely energy intensive.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThink of it this way: The only places in the universe where nuclear fusion happens naturally are in stars\u0026rsquo; cores. These cores have incredibly unique conditions. Namely, they are unimaginably hot. For example, the sun\u0026rsquo;s core runs at around 27 million degrees Fahrenheit. Those extremely hot temperatures are what sparks nuclear fusion.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTherefore, in order for scientists to replicate nuclear fusion on Earth, they need to create a reactor that gets and stays unfathomably hot. Getting something that hot requires a lot of energy. And so does keeping it that hot.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003c!--nextpage--\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eThe Nuclear Future\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGiven those requirements, the math hasn\u0026rsquo;t worked out to make nuclear fusion viable. Until recently, every nuclear fusion experiment has resulted in a negative net energy gain.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut late last year, physicists at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory in California announced that they had created the world\u0026rsquo;s first nuclear fusion project with a positive net energy gain.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat\u0026rsquo;s a huge deal. The one obstacle that has kept nuclear fusion from becoming a viable reality has just been removed.\u0026nbsp; The Livermore project has set in motion a multi-decade trend of nuclear fusion technology reshaping the world\u0026rsquo;s energy system. We now have clear visibility to the world being powered by nothing more than a few nuclear fusion reactors by 2040.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eForget oil and gas. Forget windmills and giant solar farms. In the future, all we may need to power the world is a few nuclear fusion reactors.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNeedless to say, the operators of those reactors could be the world\u0026rsquo;s most valuable companies. Their stocks could be the market\u0026rsquo;s biggest winners.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cb\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT730519\u0026amp;eid=MKT754259\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAnd the time to invest in the Nuclear Fusion Revolution is now\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/b\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eStay on the Cutting Edge\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eI like to stay on the cutting edge of world-changing technological developments. That\u0026rsquo;s where all the big money is made on Wall Street \u0026ndash; taking big and bold stakes on early stage companies pioneering breakthrough technologies.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs someone hyper-focused on the cutting edge of tech, I\u0026rsquo;m foaming-at-the-mouth bullish on nuclear fusion technology.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNuclear power is the mysterious \u0026ldquo;limitless energy\u0026rdquo; source that will solve the world\u0026rsquo;s energy needs forever. Technical challenges have held it back for decades. But for the first time ever, we are overcoming those challenges.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe result? A nuclear power boom over the next decade, wherein nuclear fusion reactors reshape the world\u0026rsquo;s energy landscape.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eI\u0026rsquo;m not the only one taking notice. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eJust two weeks ago, Microsoft inked what is believed to be the first-ever commercial nuclear fusion deal. The titan will purchase nuclear fusion electricity from startup Helion Energy by 2028.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe agreement specifically states that Helion will produce electricity through fusion by 2028. And the startup will target power generation for Microsoft of at least 50 megawatts after a year or pay financial penalties.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis is a huge deal! Clearly, Microsoft \u0026ndash; one of the world\u0026rsquo;s smartest companies \u0026ndash; believes that nuclear fusion is just years away from being a viable reality. In fact, company president Brad Smith said, \u0026ldquo;We wouldn\u0026rsquo;t enter into this agreement if we were not optimistic that engineering advances are gaining momentum.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOh, and Helion Energy \u0026ndash; the startup that Microsoft is buying nuclear fusion energy from \u0026ndash; is backed by Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI \u0026ndash; creator of ChatGPT.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFolks, the smart money has spoken. The limitless energy revolution has arrived. \u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT730519\u0026amp;eid=MKT754259\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAnd the time to claim your stake in this wealth-generation phenomenon is now.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eThe Final Word\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLuckily, \u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT730519\u0026amp;eid=MKT754259\"\u003ewe have the top \u0026ldquo;limitless energy\u0026rdquo; stock for you. \u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt\u0026rsquo;s a tiny, brand-new firm. And it\u0026rsquo;s developing the next-gen computers that we believe will be the foundation for more effectively generating nuclear fusion energy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIndeed, we think they will be the foundation of the Limitless Energy Revolution.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnd the stock of the firm making these computers is currently trading for less than $10.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBut time is of the essence here \u0026ndash; \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ebecause this tiny stock is already up more than 160% in 2023 alone!\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eInvestors are starting to buy it up in a hurry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://orders.investorplace.com/?cid=MKT730519\u0026amp;eid=MKT754259\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eReveal its name, ticker symbol, and key business details.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the date of publication, Luke Lango did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eMore From InvestorPlace\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2022/07/little-known-apple-project/?cid=MKT639809\u0026amp;eid=MKT752244\"\u003eBuy This $5 Stock BEFORE This Apple Project Goes Live\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2023/04/one-of-the-worlds-biggest-tech-breakthroughs-could-be-happening-in-americas-heartland/?cid=MKT714907\u0026amp;eid=MKT752250\"\u003eWall Street Titan: Here\u0026rsquo;s My #1 Stock for 2023\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2022/06/this-could-be-the-best-deal-in-the-history-of-independent-investing-research/?cid=MKT638063\u0026amp;eid=MKT752246\"\u003eThe $1 Investment You MUST Take Advantage of Right Now\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/2021/01/one-percenter-issues-urgent-warning/?cid=MKT499868\u0026amp;eid=MKT752252\"\u003eIt doesn\u0026rsquo;t matter if you have $500 or $5 million. Do this now.\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\t\t\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe post \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/hypergrowthinvesting/2023/07/nuclear-power-breakthrough-makes-limitless-energy-possible/\"\u003eNuclear Power Breakthrough Makes \u0026#8216;Limitless\u0026#8217; Energy Possible\u003c/a\u003e appeared first on \u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com\"\u003eInvestorPlace\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","url":"https://investorplace.com/hypergrowthinvesting/2023/07/nuclear-power-breakthrough-makes-limitless-energy-possible/?utm_source=benzinga\u0026utm_medium=quotes\u0026cc=quotes\u0026cp=benzinga","image":[],"channels":[],"stocks":["MSFT"],"tags":[]},"33455478":{"id":33455478,"author":"TalkMarkets","created":"Sat, 29 Jul 2023 13:21:00 -0400","updated":"Sat, 29 Jul 2023 13:21:33 -0400","title":"2023 Percentage Returns Of 5 Largest Stocks - Saturday, July 29","teaser":"The total market capitalization of the 5 largest U.S. companies equals around $9.79 trillion. Hence, as you read along, you\u0026rsquo;ll find undervalued tech stocks on the brink of explosive growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLet\u0026rsquo;s look at seven millionaire-maker tech\u0026nbsp;stocks to watch that continue to fly under the radar and guide you on your wealth-building journey.\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cstrong\u003eGOOG\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/goog-googl1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"Google launches Bard AI. Google search bar on a phone in hand with release information on background. Google Bard AI vs OpenAI ChatGPT. GOOG stock and GOOGL stock.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: salarko / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGOOG\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) has effectively etched its mark as a juggernaut in the realm of search, boasting a massive presence in AI.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSome would argue that it missed a step or two in the AI wars among the top tech giants, lagging its rivals in the stock market this year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, its strategic focus on integrating AI capabilities, with the release of its powerful chatbot Bard, YouTube\u0026rsquo;s robust presence, and Google Cloud\u0026rsquo;s expansion, have positioned the firm for impressive long-term expansion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt wrapped up another impressive quarter, marked by comfortable beats across both lines. \u003ca href=\"https://dazeinfo.com/2023/07/27/alphabet-earnings-revenue-profit-advertising-google-cloud-q2-2023/\"\u003eIt delivered a whopping $74.6 billion in sales\u003c/a\u003e in its second quarter, up over 7% year-over-year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCEO Sundar Pichai\u0026rsquo;s speech during its second-quarter earnings call indicates the firm\u0026rsquo;s AI-first strategy and how it\u0026rsquo;s the most significant existential challenge to conquer. Hence, the recovery narrative for Alphabet is solid at this point.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlibaba\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cstrong\u003eBABA\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/baba1600b-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"A photo of the Alibaba (BABA) app on a smartphone.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: BigTunaOnline / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eChina offers a blend of tremendous potential and substantial risks, a narrative crystallized with multiple tech players, including eCommerce giant \u003cstrong\u003eAlibaba\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/baba-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBABA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e), in the government\u0026rsquo;s cross-hairs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAmidst this complexity, Alibaba seems to be back in its stride again, treading the turbulent waters of China\u0026rsquo;s AI industry with aplomb. The tech behemoth\u0026rsquo;s \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/alibaba-baba-intensifies-chatbot-battle-145502228.html\"\u003eintroduction of Tongyi Qianwen\u003c/a\u003e, a large language model to power digital assistants, manifests its innovative gene.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe founder of Alibaba\u0026rsquo;s cloud division assumes the mantle of its AI lab in Zhejiang province. This strategic maneuver will probably add more value to BABA stock and its financials over the long term.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThough its core businesses have struggled, the firm reported a 2% year-over-year sales growth figure in mid-May. Hence, despite the short-term concerns, the long-term opportunity for investors remains as attractive as ever in BABA stock.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMSFT\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) is a master of innovation and remains an appealing choice for long-term investors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt boasts a powerful portfolio with several robust segments.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe stock is up by more than 40% this year due to its early adoption of AI and the heartening results from its Azure cloud segment. Azure delivered a commendable 27% growth in its first quarter, followed by a remarkable 15% bump in the second.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe cloud may serve as Microsoft\u0026rsquo;s growth locomotive in the near term, but \u003ca href=\"https://time.com/6279668/satya-nadella-microsoft-leadership-brief/\"\u003eCEO Satya Nadella sets his sights on AI\u003c/a\u003e as a future expansion platform. At present, AI is an impressive novelty with limited commercial value.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, the narrative could quickly change as Microsoft weaves AI into its existing product suite. Additionally, it sits comfortably on its humongous net cash pile of more than $50 billion, primed for strategic long-term investment and innovation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cstrong\u003eTSLA\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThough the electric vehicle sector is notoriously unpredictable, \u003cstrong\u003eTesla\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/tsla-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTSLA\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e)\u0026nbsp; has consistently proven to be a game-changer in the space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIts robust second-quarter results have drawn attention recently. Though it surpassed earnings and revenue estimates, Tesla\u0026rsquo;s shares took an unexpected hit. It delivered a heartening 47% yearly revenue surge to $24.9 billion with earnings per share of 91 cents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTesla is looking to push through in the autonomous driving sphere, a sector poised to deliver the goods for the EV behemoth over the long term.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt recently earmarked over \u003ca href=\"https://www.enterpriseai.news/2023/07/21/tesla-to-spend-1b-on-ai-supercomputer-not-falling-for-llms/#:~:text=Tesla%20will%20spend%20%241%20billion,capabilities%20for%20its%20autonomous%20cars.\"\u003e$1 billion for enhancing its supercomputer Dojo\u0026rsquo;s capabilities\u003c/a\u003e, inching closer to achieving peak efficiency in autonomous driving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite recent strategic decisions, including Cybertruck production slowdown and price reductions affecting profit margins, market sentiment has turned unfavorable. Hence, it\u0026rsquo;s probably the right time to pounce on TSLA stock.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHimax Technologies\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cstrong\u003eHIMX\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/himx-1600-300x169.png\" alt=\"Shipping label of a box from Himax. HIMX stock.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Mamat Suryadi / Shutterstock\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTaiwan-based \u003cstrong\u003eHimax Technologies\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/himx-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHIMX\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) might be a modest player in the vast semiconductor landscape and is poised to make massive long-term strides in the upcoming years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.fortunebusinessinsights.com/semiconductor-market-102365\"\u003eAccording to Fortune Business Insights\u003c/a\u003e, This powerful contender could gain substantially from a semiconductor industry that\u0026rsquo;s likely to bloom from $527.8 billion in 2021 to an astounding $1.38 trillion by 2029.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt has the backdrop of a resurgent sector and growth catalysts at hand, namely the economic recovery in China and the EV revolution.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEncouragingly, its sound financial health, evidenced by its strong cash reserves of more than $200 million and long-term debt of $41 million, points to an encouraging time ahead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHimax Technologies has multiple growth levers and a robust balance sheet. For investors with an eye on the long-term, this under-the-radar stock could be a rewarding contrarian pick.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSplunk\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(\u003cstrong\u003eSPLK\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/splk-stock-1-300x169.jpg\" alt=\"Splunk (SPLK) logo on the company office in Santana Row.\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\"\u003e\u003cdiv\u003eSource: Michael Vi / Shutterstock.com\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWith a fresh leadership lineup and a reinvigorated business model, \u003cstrong\u003eSplunk\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003cstrong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/splk-stock-quote/\"\u003eSPLK\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e) is in a rather exciting transformation phase.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe transition from licensing to a software-as-a-service subscription model was rather sluggish, but the tides are turning in their favor. Tipranks analysts project a healthy 16% upside from its current levels, signaling a potential investment opportunity.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSplunk\u0026rsquo;s first quarter of 2024 heralded stellar numbers. \u003ca href=\"https://www.splunk.com/en_us/newsroom/press-releases/2023/splunk-announces-fiscal-first-quarter-2024-financial-results.html\"\u003eA 30% year-on-year jump in cloud sales, touching $419 million\u003c/a\u003e, and an impressive free cash flow of more than $480 million are testaments to the company\u0026rsquo;s sturdy footing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAlso, with a sizable $1 billion earmarked for research and development, the firm is positioned to navigate an innovation-led growth path.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFurthermore, Splunk\u0026rsquo;s security and observability segment boasts a staggering $100 billion total addressable market. This spells a promising forecast for the next half-decade, making Splunk an enticing tech stock.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eACM Research\u003c/strong\u003e (\u003cstrong\u003eACMR\u003c/strong\u003e)\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eACM Research\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/acmr-stock-quote/\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eACMR\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e) continues to turn heads with its financial performances, registering double-digit growth across both lines year-over-year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to Seeking Alpha analysts, it\u0026rsquo;s anticipated to exhibit a solid 40% revenue growth this year, followed by 20% and 15.8% over the subsequent two years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDespite having stellar financial health, \u003ca href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/ACMR/valuation/metrics\"\u003eACM stock trades at just 1.4 times forward sales estimates\u003c/a\u003e. That is roughly 51% lower than its sector average.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWith ACM\u0026rsquo;s massive exposure to China fueling geopolitical risk apprehensions, its stock price remains mighty attractive. Nevertheless, ACM\u0026rsquo;s potential as a high-growth player shouldn\u0026rsquo;t be underestimated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIts growth trajectory paints an encouraging picture, setting the stage for the company\u0026rsquo;s promising future in the semiconductor industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the date of publication, Muslim Farooque did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article.\u0026nbsp;The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/\"\u003ePublishing Guidelines\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMuslim Farooque is a keen investor and an optimist at heart.
